titleStmt.title: J. Saige Dury et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4415

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Louisa, Laurance Co. Ky Nov. 2nd '63
To His Excellency
Gov. Bramlette

Dear Sir: Your petitioners would respectfully represent that a Judgement was rendered at the October Term of the Laurance Circuit Court against in favor of the Commonwealth against Reese Owens for $60,,00 for keeping a Tipling house. The said Owens has since enlisted in the 39th Reg. of Ky. Vol., & in consideration of his patriotism we would pray you to remit his said fine.

J, S, Dury, Comth Atty.
J W Hawes P J L C
L Moore
R, F, Vinson C, L, C, C
The deft Ownes has Enlsited in my company I hope you will Remit the above fine

Nathaniel Collins Capt Co A
39 Reg Ky Vol inft
